articles.description: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca says Chelsea are ahead of where he expected them to be, but the Blues boss doesn't believe they are ready to be title contenders yet.
articles.title: Enzo Maresca: Chelsea boss says second-placed side are ahead of expectations

articles.description: McLaren's first constructors' championship since 1998 came after the team needed "great resilience and great belief" to return to the top of F1.
articles.title: Lando Norris on McLaren's long but 'lovely' journey back to the top of F1

articles.description: Kylian Mbappe says he remains committed to playing for France despite being left out of their last two squads.
articles.title: Kylian Mbappe: Real Madrid forward says he remains committed to France

articles.description: Lewis Hamilton says he is happy his time with Mercedes "finished on a high" after "a really turbulent year".
articles.title: Lewis Hamilton says he 'finished on a high' at Mercedes after 12 years together

articles.description: Scottie Scheffler produces a superb final round to cap a fine year by retaining his Hero World Challenge title.
articles.title: World Hero Golf Challenge: Scottie Scheffler ties record for most wins in season

articles.description: BBC Sport looks at five things we learned from the opening round of the 2024-25 Investec Champions Cup.
articles.title: Investec Champions Cup 2024-25: Five things we learned from opening round

articles.description: India captain Rohit Sharma says the manner of his side's second-Test thrashing by Australia will not leave his players with mental scars.
articles.title: Rohit Sharma: India's players not scarred by Australia thrashing

articles.description: With Lewis Hamilton moving to Ferrari and exciting rookies joining the Formula 1 grid, here are the key things to look out for in 2025.
articles.title: Formula 1 in 2025: From Lewis Hamilton to Ferrari to new rookie drivers, what to look out for next season

articles.description: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta rues "small margins" after the Gunners miss chance to move to within four points of Premier League leaders Liverpool.
articles.title: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta rues 'small margins' but are Gunners too reliant on set pieces?

articles.description: Tottenham Hotspur defender Cristian Romero says manager Ange Postecoglou still has the backing of the players after the club's frustrating 4-3 loss to Chelsea.
articles.title: Tottenham Hotspur: Romero backs Postecoglou after Chelsea defeat
